title: Sources
text:
The dataset used in this analysis is the Adult Census Income dataset, which can be found on Kaggle. This dataset includes demographic information and income levels for adults in the United States. It was originally extracted from the 1994 Census database.




Title: Adult Census Income
Source: Kaggle
Link: Adult Census Income Dataset on Kaggle
Description: The dataset includes the following variables: age, workclass, education, marital status, occupation, relationship, race, sex, hours per week, native country, and income level. The primary goal is to predict whether an individual’s income exceeds $50K per year based on these attributes.
Usage: This dataset was used to explore the impact of race and gender on income and to build predictive models to estimate income levels.




If you use this dataset in your work, please cite it as follows:
Bansal, Lovish. “Adult Census Income.” Kaggle, 2020. https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/lovishbansal123/adult-census-income.

title: Income Prediction Based on Race and Gender
text: This project explores the impact of race and gender on income using a Bayesian Regression Model. By examining these demographic factors, we can gain insights into how they influence income levels.

title: Income Prediction Based on Race and Gender
text: This project explores the impact of race and gender on income using a Bayesian Regression Model. By examining these demographic factors, we can gain insights into how they influence income levels.

title: Income Prediction Based on Race and Gender
text:
Overview
The dataset contains demographic information such as race, gender, age, education, and income level. We will focus on race and gender as key predictors of income, applying a Bayesian Regression Model to estimate the relationship.

title: Income Prediction Based on Race and Gender
text:
Visualization
The following ridge plot shows the distribution of income by race and gender, with overlaid median income levels to provide a point of reference for comparison.

title: Income Prediction Based on Race and Gender
text:
Takeaway
The analysis reveals that both race and gender significantly influence income levels, with disparities evident across different racial groups and between genders. These findings highlight persistent inequalities in income distribution, underscoring the need for further exploration and potential policy interventions to address these disparities.

title: Visual Analysis
text: In this section, we explore various models and visualizations to understand the impact of race and gender on income.
